sentence.Network_en: He is known for his political savvy and strong management skills.

sentence.Network_en: The man was known to the police because of previous convictions.
sentence.Network_cn: 因为有犯罪前科，警察们都认识这个人。

sentence.Network_en: Our school had a mascot known as Freddy Bird.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们学校有一个名叫“弗雷迪小鸟”的吉祥物。

entry.def: Known is the past participle of know .

entry.tran: 知名的；出了名的；已知的
entry.def: You use known to describe someone or something that is clearly recognized by or familiar to all people or to a particular group of people.

example.tran: 他是个臭名昭著的毒贩子。

example.ex: He became one of the best known actors of his day...
example.tran: 他成了他那个时期最著名的演员之一。

entry.def: If someone or something is known for a particular achievement or feature, they are familiar to many people because of that achievement or feature.

example.ex: He is better known for his film and TV work.
example.tran: 他的影视作品更为出名。

entry.tran: 使人们知道（或清楚）；明确表示
entry.def: If you let it be known that something is the case, or you let something be known, you make sure that people know it or can find out about it.

example.ex: The Prime Minister has let it be known that he is against it...
example.tran: 首相对此明确表示反对。

example.ex: He let his preference be known to the press.
example.tran: 他向记者公开了他的偏好。

Sentence.sentence: If he keeps the palm of the hand parallel to the floor, as he would in his own culture when making known the height of a child, for example, he will very likely be greeted by laughter, in Colombia this gesture is reserved for the description of animals.
You've known from month the report is due today.
When I look at my friendship with Joe, I wonder how many people I've known whom I never disliked, but simply didn't take the time to get to know.
Mothers are far more likely than fathers to take advantage of this law,But extended leaves and part-time employment are known to be harmful to careers—for both genders.
And with women a second factor comes into play:most seem to enjoy the flexible-time arrangement(once known as the "mommy track")and never find their way back to full-time or high-level employment
She was known as a supporter of fake science.
